intro: Reynoldsia huehuensis var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed reynoldsia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and ability to retain water in its leaf axils. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in cloud forests at high elevations. Its foliage is covered in a dense layer of trichomes, which help reduce water loss and protect against herbivory. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
